metadata.title: CVE-2017-10918 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Xen through 4.8.x does not validate memory allocations during certain P2Moperations, which allows guest OS users to obtain privileged host OSaccess, aka XSA-222.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
